metadata.title: CVE-2015-8212 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
CGI handling flaw in bozohttpd in NetBSD 6.0 through 6.0.6, 6.1 through6.1.5, and 7.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code viacrafted arguments, which are handled by a non-CGI aware program.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bozohttpd - 20111118-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bozohttpd package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20111118-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
